runs.comm: more sedate start compared to yesterday's first-ball six, a good length delivery outside the off stump is left alone by Smith
well he decided to wait only one delivery, this was very short and he went back and absolutely hammered the pull and sent the ball sailing comfortably over the midwicket rope
slower ball outside off which Smith can do little with other than defend into the covers, but it's a no-ball and a free hit is coming up
and Smith takes full toll of the free hit, in the slot outside off, Smith gives himself lots of room to get under it and smites it over long-on
played straight to cover with nice timing
defends a good length ball outside off which comes in a touch, Mills mops up in his follow-through
full on off and Smith gets forward and taps it softly down to the left of mid-on and strolls through to keep Gayle off strike for the start of the second over

and he strikes first ball, Smith tried to pull a short ball which was some way from off stump, couldn't get on top of it and skied it up near the creaseline where Bracewell settled to take the return catch, despite another fielder attempting a dive to take it
and he clips his first delivery fine off the pads and down to the fence, poor line from Bracewell there
this one is also running to the fine leg fence but in an entirely different manner, short outside off and he french cuts the pull past the keeper
lovely shot from Charles, short and wide outside off, he played a cracking cut in the style of Rahul Dravid but found the point fielder
goes back and inside edges a full delivery on off into his pads
slower ball outside off and Charles dabs it to backward point, Gayle will finally face a delivery with 10% of the innings over
Gayle is respectful and leaves his first delivery alone as it slants across him
goes back in the crease and defends a good ball on off with a minimum of fuss
slower ball served up outside off and Gayle moves slowly into the drive and eases it to cover
gets forward to a full ball on middle and off and Gayle defends to cover this time
and Gayle has played out a maiden as he slices a drive to point, but the overriding sense is that he is biding his time and waiting for the right moment to explode
and he is greeted by an aggressive stroke from Charles who lofts a cover drive over the inner ring, it slows up and Nicol pulls it back inside the rope
this one makes it to the fence, Charles gave himself a bit of room to an already wide delivery outside off and carved it past a diving cover
slower ball on the stumps, Charles waits in the crease before turning it backward of square with deft use of the wrists
good length ball on middle and leg which Gayle flips off his hips into the leg side to open his account after seven deliveries
subtle change of pace on the full ball outside off, Charles waits for it and opens the face to guide it through backward point
this is a good length ball on off, Gayle goes back and wristily taps it into the leg side, sets off for a tight single but the throw is off-target
Gayle waits in the crease and punches off the back foot to the right of cover and Gayle coolly strolls through
gets this to swing away a touch outside off from a good length, Charles covers the swing and opens the face to play to point
loopy slower ball outside off and Charles can't generate any power from the attempted drive into the covers
backs away to the leg side and tries to hit over the top on the off side, Mills follows him and cramps him for room and Charles can't make contact
another slower ball outside off and Charles hits it to mid-off on the edge of the circle allowing him to run through
Gayle gets forward to defend another slower ball on off with soft hands into the covers and he hurries off (in as hurried a manner as Chris Gayle can hurry) to make his ground
starts with a full toss which dips rapidly on Gayle, who is bamboozled and gets a thick edge which beats third man who dives in vain
pushes this into the covers and Gayle again shows a keen awareness for the single
full ball on off from back over the wicket to the right-hander, flicked through square leg
Gayle squeezes a full ball back down the pitch to the bowler, Ellis relying heavily on changes of pace
another yorker length delivery on off and Gayle digs it out to mid-off
puts this one in short and Gayle rocks back to pull through backward square, unusually he rouses himself to take a risky second but in the end it proves the right move
starts with a full ball on off and fields the drive off his own bowling
on the pads and clipped to the right of McCullum, who dives to save a run
tucked off the pads into the leg side
Gayle waits in the crease and bottom edges the cut into the covers
comes down the track and drives softly back down the pitch
almost takes out his partner here as he rocks back and bludgeons a good length ball flat at Charles who has to take evasive action as if facing a bouncer, the ball heads to long-on quickly
tapped into the covers but they can't sneak a run
Gayle waits in the crease to a back of a length ball on off and toe-ends it past the bowler down the pitch
flat, but flat enough, Charles gave himself some room and cross-bats a full ball on off over the long-on rope, just out of the diving fielder's reach
punched out to the boundary rider at deep cover
that's the Gayle the crowd were waiting for! Slower ball bouncer goes horribly wrong, ends up sitting up juicily and Gayle needs no invitation to deposit it into the stands at midwicket
tucks a full ball on the pads fine to show he can be deft as well, strange move to take Ellis off and re-introduce Bracewell costs New Zealand 18 runs in the over
goes back and forces a drive straight to the bowler
this is down leg and Charles heaves with all his might but doesn't time it and it dribbles away to fine leg's left
fired flat and fast outside off near the wide line, beats Gayle's stabby attempt at a drive
responds by thumping this ball in the slot on off stump into the stands at cow corner, the brute force on display there
goes back into the crease and punches down to long-off
Charles gives himself a touch of room and using the bottom hand, he shovels a drive down to long-on
starts this over poorly with a full toss on the pads but Charles picks out fine leg with the flick
another full toss but this is low on the bat after being fired into the pads and Charles squeezes it out to wide long-on
wide, far too wide outside off and Gayle isn't drawn into a stroke
Gayle pushes this through wide midwicket off the pads
good length ball outside off with the pace held back again and punched into the covers for another run of the singular kind
full toss on leg and Gayle can do little but push it out to the fielders in the deep with all the pace taken off it
another full toss to Charles who swipes it out to deep midwicket
Charles backs away and mistimes an ungainly drive down to mid-off
full toss delivered in a ramrod straight line on middle and Gayle flicks it out to the fielder at cow corner
fortune there for Charles, full outside off, he resorts to a big heave across the line with minimal foot movement and gets a thick inside edge which beats a diving Latham and heads down to the rope
followed up with a ball outside the wide lines on the off side and Charles can let it go
this time Southee gets it just inside the line and Charles is forced to leave it after moving his front foot to leg which put him in no position to reach it
Charles goes for an extravagant drive outside off but flails without making contact
moves across off stump this time and pushes between cover and point
fired through outside off, Gayle hits with timing to cover on the edge and sets off for a single and makes it comfortably

smartly taken catch by Southee at fine leg, makes it look much simpler than it was, Charles had moved across and tried to paddle pull a short ball on middle and leg over the head of the fielder at fine leg, Southee dives well and grasps it cleanly
gets forward and drives straight to cover
full on the stumps and wristily played through the open acres in the mid-on region
full outside off and Gayle squeezes it out through backward point, it is dribbling towards the rope but is well cut off by the boundary rider
goes for a big swing to leg but gets a thick inside edge into his pad
Simmons plays it towards mid-off, who spots Gayle out of his crease and dive throws it into the stumps but Gayle has made his ground by then
played down to third man
oh my goodness, that is ludicrous, absolutely ridiculous, a full ball on off and Gayle plays a short-arm loft which nevertheless generates a gigantic amount of power and elevation over long-on
follows it up with another meaty blow, poor length lets Gayle send another missile flying into the crowd at long-on
Gayle slices this full toss on off over the covers and has enough power to get it to the rope and bring up his half-century
beaten outside as he pokes at a full ball. Yes Gayle was beaten there, a rather rare occurence
this is slanted across the right hander from around the wicket and Simmons shoulders arms
wristily flicks it down the pitch but the bowler collects
Simmons decides to emulate Gayle, gets underneath a ball in the slot on middle and sends it packing over the long-on boundary
flicks it off the pads out into the deep to keep strike
Mills replaces Bracewell and Simmons digs a blockhole delivery back to the bowler
a slow full toss outside off and Simmons slashes it to the sweeper at deep cover

Mills fools Gayle there and even deceives the keeper too, a slower ball which is sent down as an off-spinner and it spins away from Gayle's attempted poke, Latham fumbles behind the stumps before regathering
hits out into the deep on the off side
another slow full toss outside off and Simmons drives it along the carpet down to long-off
Gayle is again bamboozled by Mills who has been excellent today, misses another slower ball outside off
slices a drive out to deep cover

bowled 'em! An absolutely massive blow struck by the bowler there, Gayle tried to heave a full ball on middle, delivered from around the wicket, into the leg side but got a bottom edge which knocked back middle stump
and works his first ball to the fielder inside the ring at midwicket
charges down and goes for an uncultured heave, slices it just out of the reach of cover on the circle's edge

Simmons decides to take over where Gayle left off, gets down on a knee and slog sweeps, making excellent contact and once again bringing the stewards on the other side of the midwicket rope into action
tries to repeat the dose as he pulls a short ball on leg backward of square but picks out Southee stationed a metre off the rope in exactly that place
Dwayne Bravo sends his first ball packing, Southee delivers it wide outside off from around the wicket allowing Bravo to get under it and hammer it over long-off
Sammy picks up his first boundary by freeing the arms and driving through the covers and beats the fielder in the deep
slugs a full ball on the stumps out towards cow corner
back of the hand slower ball results in an error in the line, this one slides down leg past the flick and will have to be re-bowled
excellent yorker to finish, nothing he could do there other than jam down on it
worked to short fine leg
driven down to long-on
Dwayne Bravo gets behind a good length ball on middle and hoists it with all his might into the stands at midwicket, a powerfully struck pull
worked away into the leg side once more, they think of a second but it isn't forthcoming
Simmons backs away and slugs a full toss on leg, from around the wicket, out to cow corner where the fielder in the deep mops up
very full on leg stump and clipped away through midwicket softly enough that they can take on the fielder's arm successfully
Southee starts with a good full ball outside off which is dug out into the covers
Dwayne Bravo is taking Pollard's mantle on in his Trinidadian team-mate's absence, smites a massive blow over the boundary at cow corner
fired into the pads as the batsmen backs away, messily squeezed out behind the stumps where Latham hits the stumps with the under-arm flick but they have safely made it through
drills a full toss on the stumps down the ground and they rush back for two with the ball bisecting the fielders in the deep nicely
slower ball sits up outside off but Sammy can't generate any power from the slog and it lobs tamely into the hands of the stand-in skipper at cover
full toss on off stump is driven to cover who doesn't risk a shy at the stumps
Ellis starts the final over with a full ball on the stumps which is forced away into the covers

Bravo gets his placement just right here, launched a full ball over the bowler's head, Guptill running round from long-off puts in an outstretched dive but can't reach it as it lands inside the rope before going over
filthy bowling, absolutely horrible delivery, full toss at waist height on leg and Bravo easily hoists that over the fine leg rope, luckily not a no-ball for the bowler as well
fired into leg stump, backs away and drives to Guptill at long-off, Samuels showed no urgency or thought of a second
another full toss angling into the pads, Bravo precisely plays it out towards cow corner and urges Samuels through for the second

Samuels tries to send the final ball into orbit - but it's well bowled targeting the pads and he inside edges it into the pads, rolls away into the off side as the West Indies end on another solid total of 177 for 5
